freefromthreads: Thank you for being so open and showing people that having a Stoma is nothing to be ashamed of!! Uoyr journey is amazing 💪💪
cvermaat: You are very brave being so open! I have only experienced ‘living with a stoma’ from a sideline, as a good friend of mine had one. In that respect, he has become a significant part of the main character in my books ( TREGUNNA) in which I try to express that someone who has a stoma, can live a normal life and can work like everyone else.
zoella1974: I had my J-pouch surgery 16 years ago and I am a healthy and happy human. I was weirdly fond of my stoma too! The key is to learn to love your body, no matter how it looks & feels at any one time. Appreciate it’s not always a good experience for us poor sufferers, so my heart goes out to anyone suffering today ❤️
carlos_duarte_vaz: Respekt from me. I have this 9 Month. I know what that is👍😊
3a___90: Beautiful 💗 thank you for sharing this you’re amazing 💕
sarahwithstars: Happy birthday Mona, thanks for keeping mum alive for the year xxx
world_egg_mother: Hey im a mother please help me😢
invisiyouth: We are so thankful for you being so open about your health journey! It's massively important to bring that awareness amd get conversations started! You are such a rockstar in our eyes👊👊
